alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Columbus; New Hanover; Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Brunswick, Columbus, New Hanover and Pender. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wilmington, Leland, Carolina Beach, Burgaw, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Surf City, Ocean Isle Beach, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, North Masonboro Island, Johnny Mercer Pier, Figure Eight Island, Rich Inlet, Iredell, Hampstead, Boiling Spring Lakes, Carolina Shores and Calabash. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
